page.title: 20RURAL POLICING DOLPHINTON
page.content: The village of Dolphintion is divided into two seperate police areas. The west side is covered by Strathclyde Police Force and the east side by Lothian and Borders. Vandalism is on the increase and over the past two years there have been a number of housebreakings in the district. The house-breaking crimes, so far deteced, have been carried out by persons from Edinburgh and further afield. A policeman in rural areas has different duties to carry out from his colleagues in the city, such as prevention and detection of sheep-worrying and poaching and supervision of compulsory sheep-dipping. One advantage is that the policeman has knowledge of most of the residents in the area. Law and order seems to be well controlled in Dolphinton in the 1980s.
